result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy D. Mortensen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.

Supervision fees
DNA Sample
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
03:06 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Timothy D. Mortensen appeared in court, Attorney Gary S. Cirilli for Timothy D. Mortensen appeared in court. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Pfeifer states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Court will set out for arraignment/pretrial conference. Bond continued. adj. 03:08 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

No intoxicants/No taverns/No driving a motor vehicle without a valid license

Pfeifer statement to bail. Court questions Defendant on address/employment. Court sets bond. Defendant to appear in person at next hearing. adj. 01:56 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 28, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
